oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville College for Young Ladies Closing Exercises Program
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nashville College for Young Ladies was opened in 1880 by Dr. George W.F. Price, and was popularly known as Price's school. At the time of the closing exercises in 1882, the school was located on Spruce Street. It was later located on Broad Street at Vauxhall, now known as 9th Avenue South. The school closed in 1899 after the death of its founder. 5 x 7 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville College for Young Ladies
Education; Private schools
Nashville (Tenn.); Spruce Street; Broad Street
